title: Building an AI Evaluation Platform on GCP: Architecture of a Multi-Cluster System
summary: A deep dive into the architecture behind a production-grade AI agent evaluation system spanning multiple Cloud Run services, GKE clusters, and managed databases with event-driven orchestration.

title: Event-Driven Architecture on GCP: Pub/Sub, Cloud Tasks, and Cloud Scheduler
summary: How we orchestrated a 6-phase AI evaluation pipeline with dozens of Pub/Sub topics, dead-letter queues, Cloud Tasks, Cloud Scheduler, and zero silent failures.

title: The Database Bug That Took Down Our AI Pipeline: Debugging AlloyDB SSL Drops
summary: How we diagnosed and fixed random SSL connection failures in AlloyDB that caused 5% of our evaluation tasks to fail. A 3-line config change that saved hundreds of engineering hours.

title: How to Build Idempotent Cloud Tasks Handlers in Python
summary: The pattern that eliminated our duplicate record bugs. A practical guide using FastAPI, PostgreSQL, and deterministic UUIDs for at-least-once delivery systems.

title: Zero-Downtime Embedding Migration: Switching Models in a Production RAG System
summary: Step-by-step playbook for migrating embedding models in production using pgvector. Two environment variables made the difference between a 2-day migration and a 2-week one.

title: Building an RL Training Arena for AI Code Agents on GCP
summary: A reinforcement learning environment for training AI coding agents. Gym-style API, Cloud Build sandboxing, Redis episode state, and Firestore trajectory recording.

title: How I Audited Our AI Platform and Found Critical Security Gaps
summary: A systematic security audit revealed SQL injection, hardcoded credentials, and secrets in production logs. Here's the methodology and how we remediated them.

title: Building the Core AI Evaluation Engine: AlloyDB Fixes, Autoscaling, and a Headless API
summary: Deep dive into the core evaluation engine covering AlloyDB SSL fixes, KEDA autoscaling, Firestore misrouting, continuous learning, and a headless API for external integrations.

title: Building an Automated LLM Scoring Service: From Prototype to Production
summary: From idempotent Cloud Tasks to LiteLLM proxy integration, Redis state management, VPC networking battles, and a complete logging overhaul. How we shipped an automated rating service end to end.

title: Building an Auth Gateway with Admin Dashboard: JWT, OIDC, and Notifications Admin
summary: Authentication gateway with Google OIDC, JWT validation, Kong integration, and a notifications admin dashboard with pagination and delivery logs.

title: Building a Notification Service: Cloud Tasks Delivery, Circuit Breakers, and Webhook Dispatch
summary: Production notification service with Cloud Tasks delivery, circuit breakers, dead-letter queues, subscription management, and schema migrations from scratch.

title: Building a RAG Retrieval Service: pgvector, Embedding Migrations, and Provenance Tracking
summary: RAG retrieval service with pgvector for similarity search. Emergency embedding model migration in 48 hours with zero downtime, plus provenance tracking for evaluation calibration.

title: Building an RL Training Arena: Gym-Style API and Cloud Build Sandboxing
summary: Reinforcement learning arena for AI coding agents. Gym-style API, Cloud Build sandboxing, Redis episode management, and a multi-step preprocessor pipeline built from the ground up.

title: The Connective Tissue of an AI Platform: Workflow, Taxonomy, Auth, and Memory
summary: The services that turned a collection of microservices into a platform: HITL workflow orchestration with WebSocket, taxonomy-based task routing, JWT auth fixes, and LLM memory evaluation.

title: Incident Response & CLI Agent Debugging: Runbooks, Silent Failures, and Sandbox Fixes
summary: Building incident runbooks with 70+ diagnostic commands, debugging silent agent failures where exit code 0 hid API errors, and fixing sandbox environment gaps.

title: Systematic Service Hardening: Security, Performance, and Reliability
summary: One week, three services: fixed N+1 queries, race conditions, SSRF vulnerabilities, non-atomic counters, and wrote 124 tests where there were zero.

title: How I Find Bugs in Production Code: Filing 33 Issues in One Week
summary: A 5-layer audit methodology for production codebases â€” from API surface validation to security vulnerabilities. Path traversal, datetime bugs, and CORS misconfigurations.
